channel.title: Warhead dropped by "unknown" attackers destroys parts of St. Petersburg, Russia
channel.description:
(pictures taken from very far away)
[img]http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2012/02/08/article-2098164-11A345EA000005DC-11_634x443.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2012/02/08/article-2098164-11A34617000005DC-299_634x443.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2012/02/08/article-2098164-11A345FE000005DC-985_634x447.jpg[/img]
yea I joke
http://youtu.be/rNY2LTJ0NDA
I would fucking shit my pants, it looks like a nuke going off
anyway people are saying its a power plant/bomb/martians

item.title: Warhead dropped by "unknown" attackers destroys parts of St. Petersburg, Russia
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I saw the video before it got big and was content with it being a powerplant failure, now news websites are seriously making it out as an apocalyptic/battle/whatever scene? fukken journalism for ya

Read full topic
item.source: Warhead dropped by "unknown" attackers destroys parts of St. Petersburg, Russia

item.title: Warhead dropped by "unknown" attackers destroys parts of St. Petersburg, Russia
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

There was a video of it from another angle showing the transformer arcing.

Read full topic

item.title: Warhead dropped by "unknown" attackers destroys parts of St. Petersburg, Russia
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Definitely looks like some sort of transformer malfunctioning

Few years back a transformer at the local fairgrounds did something like that, and it was overcast and foggy that night so the light looked like it was a lot bigger than it actually was

Read full topic
